DOC.brief_summary: Prevalence of chronic pain after mastectomy is beyond 50% 3 months after surgery. This pain is related to a sensitization of the central nervous system through N-methyl-D-asparate (NMDA) receptors. Ketalar might prevent the occurrence of chronic pain by anti-NMDA properties after mastectomy.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Ketalar to Prevent Postoperative Chronic Pain After Mastectomy
DOC.criteria: Mastectomy in patients 18 to 80 years old American Society of Anesthesiology (ASA) class >= 3 Renal, heart or hepatic failure Allergy to ketalar Psychiatric disease Chronic antalgic treatment
DOC.keyword: Chronic pain after mastectomy for breast cancer
